sen.j: 安国造（やすのくにのみやつこ・やすこくぞう)は近江国東部(琵琶湖東岸)を支配した国造。
sen.e: Yasu no kuninomiyatsuko (Yasu kokuzo) is the Kuninomiyatsuko (kokuzo: the head of a local government) who governed the eastern part of Omi Province (the east coast of Lake Biwa).
Yasu no kuninomiyatsuko (Yasu kokuzo) was the Kuninomiyatsuko (kokuzo: the head of a local government) who governed the eastern part of Omi Province (the east coast of Lake Biwa).
Yasu no kuninomiyatsuko (Yasu kokuzo) was the Kuninomiyatsuko (kokuzo: the head of a local government) who governed the eastern part of Omi Province (the east coast of Lake Biwa).

sen.j: 淡海安国造・近淡海安国造とも。
sen.e: It is also called Omi no Yasu no kuninomiyatsuko (Omi no Yasu kokuzo) or Chikatsuomi no Yasu no kuninomiyatsuko (Chikatsuomi no Yasu kokuzo).
It is also called Omi no Yasu no kuninomiyatsuko (Omi no Yasu kokuzo) or Chikatsuomi no Yasu no kuninomiyatsuko (Chikatsuomi no Yasu kokuzo).
It is also called Omi no Yasu no kuninomiyatsuko (Omi no Yasu kokuzo) or Chikatsuomi no Yasu no kuninomiyatsuko (Chikatsuomi no Yasu kokuzo).

sen.j: 『古事記』によると祖は日子坐王の子の水穂真若王で、淡海国造と同系。
sen.e: According to "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), The earliest ancestor is Mizuhonomawaka no Miko, a son of Hikoimasu no Miko (a prince of Emperor Kaika), and it is related to Omi no kuninomiyatsuko (Omi kokuzo).
sen.cmt: 知識が無い読者を想定して、日子坐王が開化天皇の皇子であるという情報を捕捉しました。
sen.e: According to "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), the earliest ancestor was Mizuhonomawaka no Miko, a son of Hikoimasu no Miko (a prince of Emperor Kaika), and it was related to Omi no kuninomiyatsuko (Omi kokuzo).
sen.cmt: , The→, theに修正しました。文法を修正しました。is→was
sen.e: According to "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), the earliest ancestor was Mizuhonomawaka no Miko, a son of Hikoimasu no Miko (a prince of Emperor Kaika), and it was related to Omi no kuninomiyatsuko (Omi kokuzo).
The clan is Yasu clan.
sen.cmt: 原文は単語のみですが、句点があるので省略のある文であると判断し、文の形になるように補足しました。以下こうした場合には「文にするために省略部分を補足」と記入します。
sen.e: The clan was the Yasu clan.
sen.cmt: 文法を修正しました。is→wastheを追加しました。Yasu clan→the Yasu clan
sen.e: The clan was the Yasu clan.
The kabane (hereditary title) of the clan is atai (atae: a kind of kabene, given to local governors).
The kabane (hereditary title) of the clan was atai (atae: a kind of kabene, given to local governors).
The kabane (hereditary title) of the clan was atai (atae: a kind of kabene, given to local governors).
It was in Yasu County, Omi Province.
sen.cmt: 文にするために省略部分を補足。
sen.e: It was in Yasu County, Omi Province.
It was in Yasu County, Omi Province.
Yasu County is now part of Yasu City, Siga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 文にするために省略部分を補足。
sen.e: Yasu County is now part of Yasu City, Shiga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: スペルミスを修正しました。Siga→Shiga
sen.e: Yasu County is now part of Yasu City, Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 後に淡海国造の支配下に置かれたともいう。
sen.e: It is said to have later been under control of Omi no kuninomiyatsuko (Omi kokuzo).
It is said to have later been under control of Omi no kuninomiyatsuko (Omi kokuzo).
It is said to have later been under control of Omi no kuninomiyatsuko (Omi kokuzo).

tit.e: Ujigami (a guardian god of a clan)
Ujigami (a guardian god of a clan)

sen.j: 建部神社 ...... 滋賀県大津市。
sen.e: It is in Takebe Shrine in Otsu City, Siga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 文にするために省略部分を補足。
sen.e: It is in Takebe Shrine in Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: スペルミスを修正しました。Siga→Shiga
sen.e: It is in Takebe Shrine in Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture.
The enshrined deity is YAMATO Takeru no Mikoto (.a prince of Emperor Keiko, a hero in ancient Japan).
sen.cmt: 知識の無い読者を想定して、日本武尊の簡単な説明を補足しました。
sen.e: The enshrined deity is YAMATO Takeru no Mikoto (.a prince of Emperor Keiko, a hero in ancient Japan).
The enshrined deity is YAMATO Takeru no Mikoto (.a prince of Emperor Keiko, a hero in ancient Japan).
The shrine is the Ichinomiya (shrine with the highest ranking in the area) of Omi Province.
sen.cmt: 文にするために省略部分を補足。
sen.e: The shrine is the Ichinomiya (shrine with the highest ranking in the area) of Omi Province.
The shrine is the Ichinomiya (shrine with the highest ranking in the area) of Omi Province.

sen.j: 大陀牟夜別 ...... 淡海国造。
sen.e: One of the descendants is Otamuyawake, Omi no kuninomiyatsuko.
sen.cmt: 文にするために省略部分を補足。
sen.e: One of the descendants was Otamuyawake, Omi no kuninomiyatsuko.
One of the descendants was Otamuyawake, Omi no kuninomiyatsuko.
He is the earliest ancestor of Yasu no kuninomiyatsuko.
sen.cmt: 文にするために省略部分を補足。また、上の文中で「祖は日子坐王の子の水穂真若王」とあります。読者が混乱する可能性がありますが、原文に従い訳しました。可能であるなら、この部分について原文の著者に確認をした方が良いと思います。
sen.e: He was the earliest ancestor of Yasu no kuninomiyatsuko.
He was the earliest ancestor of Yasu no kuninomiyatsuko.
He is the third descendant of Hikoimasu no Miko.
sen.cmt: 文にするために省略部分を補足。
sen.e: He was the third descendant of Hikoimasu no Miko.
He was the third descendant of Hikoimasu no Miko.

sen.j: 娘の両道入姫は日本武尊に嫁いで稲依別王を産んだ。
sen.e: His daughter, Futajinoirihime married YAMATO Takeru no Mikoto and had Inayoriwake no Miko.
sen.cmt: 「古事記」と「日本書紀」では稲依別王の生母は別人です。「古事記」では「布多遅比売（ふたじひめ）」で、淡海国造である大陀牟夜別の娘です。「日本書紀」では「布多遅能伊理毘売命（ふたじのいりびめのみこと）」で、こちらは垂仁天皇の皇女です。そして原文の「両道入姫」の字が当てられているのは、調べた限り後者のみでした。大陀牟夜別の娘である「布多遅比売（ふたじひめ）」に「両道入姫（ふたじのいりひめ）」と当てて良いのかは不明です。
sen.e: His daughter, Futajinoirihime married YAMATO Takeru no Mikoto and had Inayoriwake no Miko.
His daughter, Futajinoirihime married YAMATO Takeru no Mikoto and had Inayoriwake no Miko.

sen.j: 犬上御田鍬 ...... 飛鳥時代の外交官。
sen.e: One of the descendants is INUGAMI no Mitasuki (INUKAMI no Mitasuki), a diplomat in the Asuka Period.
sen.cmt: 文にするために省略部分を補足。
sen.e: One of the descendants was INUGAMI no Mitasuki (INUKAMI no Mitasuki), a diplomat in the Asuka Period.
One of the descendants was INUGAMI no Mitasuki (INUKAMI no Mitasuki), a diplomat in the Asuka Period.
He is a Japanese envoy to Sui Dynasty China.

He is the first Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China.
sen.cmt: 文にするために省略部分を補足。
